main event: On January 22, 1956, a civilian reported a ground-visual observation of a small bluish-white object with a small tail, similar to a comet, traveling from the southwest to northeast in Miami (MacDill AFB), Florida.
interesting points: The observation was also reported from St. Petersburg, Florida, and Lakeland, Florida, suggesting a wide area of observation.
The base operations officer believed the object to be a comet or a falling meteor, observed by two different people approximately 150 miles apart.

Another sighting on January 22nd from an airliner over the Gulf of Mexico reported an elongated bright light, traveling steadily from the southern horizon to a weather front near the northern horizon in a mere six seconds.
The object was estimated to have covered about 30 degrees and maintained a steady speed with no trajectory variations.
The observation lasted only about six seconds, with the object traveling from the southern horizon to the northern horizon.
sighted object: small bluish-white object with a small tail, similar to a comet
witnesses: civilian, airline flight engineer, and copilot
